node.title: The ACT records 13 new COVID-19 cases, as 14 Canberra schools now listed as exposure sites
node.alt: Outside of the Wanniassa School Junior Campus.
node.description: Fourteen schoolÂ campuses are now listed as exposure sites in the territory as ACT Chief Minister Andrew Barr flags the next stage of eased restrictions could be brought forward.
node.content:
["The ACT has recorded 13\u00a0new COVID-19 cases.", "There is one person in hospital, that person is in intensive care and requires ventilation.\u00a0", "Yesterday, the ACT became the first jurisdiction in Australia to fully vaccinate 95 per cent of its eligible population.", "Fourteen school campuses have now been listed as exposure sites.\u00a0", "
Numerous Canberra schools visited by positive cases
", "At the weekend, additional schools were added to the the list of exposure sites by ACT Health.\u00a0", "ACT Education Minister Yvette Berry told ABC Radio Canberra that ACT Health had\u00a0been communicating with parents of impacted students.", "\"You will have been notified by health if your child is impacted, or if your school is impacted and by your school community. and if the health advice on that particular circumstance is 'well you all need to stay home', then you all need to stay home,\" Ms Berry said.", "", "
ACT Education Minister Yvette Berry says the government has been communicating with affected students and parents.(ABC News: Ian Cutmore)
", "And, when asked about compulsory mask-wearing in schools, Ms Berry said there was an element of personal choice surrounding mask-wearing for students in schools.\u00a0", "\"The students who are in years 3-5, they can wear masks if they would like to, but for students in kindergarten\u00a0and preschools up to year 2, the advice is that it could be a hazard for younger people in that age group to wear masks,\" she said.", "\"So I guess \u2026 it's a personal decision on whether or not to wear masks, but younger people move differently through our schools, have different physical activity and are a little bit more active than our older community.\"", "The 14\u00a0school campuses currently listed as exposure sites are:", "
Next step out of lockdown likely to be brought forward
", "", "
ACT Chief Minister Andrew Barr has flagged bringing forward the next step out of lockdown.(ABC News: Ian Cutmore)
", "The ACT Chief Minister Andrew Barr today flagged that the government may bring forward the next stage of the ACT's roadmap out of lockdown, due to high vaccination rates across the territory.\u00a0", "The ACT was initially slated to enter its next stage of the roadmap on November 26.", "Under the next stage of eased restrictions, there would be no restrictions on the number of visitors to a home or people at outdoor gatherings, and all retail would be allowed to operate at one person per two square metres.\u00a0", "\"You've seen the pathway forward, so it would be bringing forward those particular areas,\" Mr Barr told ABC Radio Canberra.", "An announcement is expected to be made tomorrow."]
